intro: Piper picardae, commonly known as the Picard's pepper or the Madagascar pepper, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a small, elongated berry that turns from green to yellow when mature.
